p: Semiquantitative histological scoring of liver samples from all groups is presented in Table 1. Histological analysis of the liver sections from control animals revealed normal architecture of hepatocytes. There was a moderate steatosis, fatty degeneration, and inflammatory infiltrating cells such as macrophages and neutrophils in diabetic-untreated animals. Animals treated with L. regularis (150 mg/kg) showed partial regeneration of the hepatocytes and mild inflammatory infiltrate. Animals treated with L. regularis (300 mg/kg) demonstrated regenerated hepatocytes with minor inflammatory infiltrate ( Figure 6).
